result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: Rusk Co. District Attorney
superAgency.notes: DE to complete the Rusk County DAIP, provide proof to the State, make all court appearances, keep address current, commit no further violations, if successful count shall be dismissed, if unsuccessful DE will return to court for sentencing.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on January 22, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Randy J Larson not in court.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status on DAGP.  State has heard from Aurora, they need one more participant to  begin a new class.  State requests a hearing in 90 days.  Review hearing scheduled for January 22, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Case settlement
Review hearing on October 16, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Randy J Larson in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CM94.  Court recites argreement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea to Ct in 16CM70, Ct 2 will be DRI.  DE will enter a plea in 16CM94.  DE enters a plea of G to Ct 1, 16CM70-court will note but hold in abeyance for a one year period.  DE will enroll/complete the Rusk County DAIP, provide proof to the State, make all court appearances, keep address current with the court, bond continues.  If DE complies with all conditions, count will be dismissed, if non compliant, DE will return to court for sentencing.  

16CM94-DE will enter a plea of G, court will accept and find the DE guilty,  Court accepts the recommendations of the parties, will order CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  

If DE is enrolled and attending DAIP classes, DE/Atty will not need to attend hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for October 16, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
